revision.text:
==Latin== ===Etymology=== From {{term|sum||I am|lang=la}} + {{term|ubi||in colloquial language: in which, by which, with which, wherewith; with whom, by whom|lang=la}}.
===Verb=== {{head|la|verb}} # [[sometimes]], [[sometime]] or [[another]], [[one day]] #* the play [[w:en:Pseudolus|Pseudolus]] by [[w:en:Plautus|T. Maccius Plautus]] (the [http://www.perseus.tufts.edu/hopper/text.jsp?doc=Perseus%3Atext%3A1999.02.0045%3Aact%3D5%3Ascene%3D2 text] may be read here) #*: Simo: '''''Erit ubi''' te ulciscar, si vivo.'' #*: Pseudolus: ''Quid minitare? Habeo tergum.'' #*:: Simo: There will be an opportunity for me to be revenged on you '''one day''', if I live. #*:: Pseudolus: Why do you threaten? I've got a back of my own.
====See also==== * [[sum cum]]
====Inflection==== The verb {{term|sum||I am|lang=la}} has an irregular conjugation. {{la-conj-irr-sum}}
[[mg:sum ubi]]
